verses.verse: Moreover Elihu <WH453> answered, <WH6030>
"Hear <WH8085> my words, <WH4405> you wise <WH2450> men. <WH238> Give ear to me, <WH3045> you who have knowledge.
For the ear <WH241> tries <WH974> words, <WH4405> as the palate <WH2441> tastes <WH2938> food. <WH398>
Let us choose <WH977> for us that which is right. <WH4941> Let us know <WH3045> among ourselves what is good. <WH2896>
For Job <WH347> has said, <WH559> <WH6663> 'I am righteous, God <WH410> has taken away <WH5493> my right: <WH4941>
Notwithstanding my right <WH4941> I am considered a liar. <WH3576> My wound <WH2671> is incurable, <WH605> though I am without disobedience. <WH6588>'
What man <WH1397> is like Job, <WH347> who drinks <WH8354> scorn <WH3933> like water, <WH4325>
Who goes <WH732> in company <WH2274> with the workers <WH6466> of iniquity, <WH205> and walks <WH3212> with wicked <WH7562> men? <WH582>
For he has said, <WH559> <WH5532> 'It profits a man <WH1397> nothing that he should delight <WH7521> himself with God. <WH430>'

"Therefore listen <WH8085> to me, <WH582> you men of understanding: <WH3824> far be it <WH2486> from God, <WH410> that he should do wickedness, <WH7562> from the Almighty, <WH7706> that he should commit iniquity. <WH5766>
For the work <WH6467> of a man <WH120> he will render <WH7999> to him, <WH376> and cause every man to find <WH4672> according to his ways. <WH734>
Yes surely, <WH551> God <WH410> will not do wickedly, <WH7561> neither will the Almighty <WH7706> pervert <WH5791> justice. <WH4941>
Who put him in charge <WH6485> of the earth? <WH776> or who has appointed <WH7760> him over the whole world? <WH8398>
If he set <WH7760> his heart <WH3820> on himself, <WH622> If he gathered to himself his spirit <WH7307> and his breath, <WH5397>
all flesh <WH1320> would perish <WH1478> together, <WH3162> and man <WH120> would turn again <WH7725> to dust. <WH6083>
"If now you have understanding, <WH998> hear <WH8085> this. <WH238> Listen to the voice <WH6963> of my words. <WH4405>
Shall even one who hates <WH8130> justice <WH4941> govern? <WH2280> Will you condemn <WH7561> him who is righteous <WH6662> and mighty? <WH3524>â€”
Who says <WH559> to a king, <WH4428> <WH7563> 'Vile!' or to nobles, <WH5081> <WH1100> 'Wicked!'?

Who doesn't <WH5375> respect the persons <WH6440> of princes, <WH8269> nor respects <WH5234> the rich <WH7771> more than <WH6440> the poor; <WH1800> for they all are the work <WH4639> of his hands. <WH3027>
In a moment <WH7281> they die, <WH4191> even at midnight. <WH2676> The people <WH5971> are shaken <WH1607> and pass away. <WH5674> The mighty <WH47> are taken away <WH5674> without a hand. <WH3027>
"For his eyes <WH5869> are on the ways <WH1870> of a man. <WH376> He sees <WH7200> all his goings. <WH6806>
There is no darkness, <WH2822> nor thick gloom, <WH6757> where the workers <WH6466> of iniquity <WH205> may hide themselves. <WH5641>
For he doesn't <WH7760> need to consider a man <WH376> further, <WH1980> that he should go before God <WH410> in judgment. <WH4941>
He breaks in pieces <WH7489> mighty men <WH3524> in ways past finding <WH2714> out, <WH5975> and sets others in their place. <WH312>
Therefore he takes knowledge <WH5234> of their works. <WH4566> He overturns <WH2015> them in the night, <WH3915> so that they are destroyed. <WH1792>
He strikes <WH5606> them as <WH8478> wicked men <WH7563> in the open <WH4725> sight of others; <WH7200>
because they turned aside <WH5493> from following him, <WH310> and wouldn't <WH7919> pay attention to any of his ways, <WH1870>
so that they caused the cry <WH6818> of the poor <WH1800> to come <WH935> to him. <WH8085> He heard the cry <WH6818> of the afflicted. <WH6041>

When he gives quietness, <WH8252> who then can condemn? <WH7561> When he hides <WH5641> his face, <WH6440> who then can see <WH7789> him? <WH1471> Alike whether to a nation, or to a <WH3162> man, <WH120>
that the godless <WH120> man may not reign, <WH4427> that there be no one to ensnare <WH4170> the people. <WH5971>
"For has any said <WH559> to God, <WH410> <WH5375> 'I am guilty, but I will not offend any more. <WH2254>
Teach <WH3384> me that which I don't <WH1107> see. <WH2372> If I have done <WH6466> iniquity, <WH5766> I will do it no more <WH3254>'?
Shall his recompense <WH7999> be as you desire, <WH3588> that you refuse it? <WH977> For you must choose, and not I. <WH1696> Therefore speak what you know. <WH3045>
Men <WH582> of understanding <WH3824> will tell <WH559> me, <WH2450> yes, every wise man <WH1397> who hears me: <WH8085>
<WH347> 'Job speaks <WH1696> without knowledge. <WH1847> His words <WH1697> are without wisdom. <WH7919>'
I wish <WH15> that <WH347> were tried <WH974> to the end, <WH5331> because of his answering <WH8666> like wicked <WH205> men. <WH582>
For he adds <WH3254> rebellion <WH6588> to his sin. <WH2403> He claps <WH5606> his hands among us, <WH7235> and multiplies his words <WH561> against God. <WH410>"
